item.title: Scarface: The World Is Yours PC re-release announced
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Published by EC Digital Entertainment.

Hong Kong-based publisher EC Digital Entertainment will re-release the PC version of open-world action adventure game Scarface: The World Is Yours via Steam and Epic Games Store, the company announced.

The Epic Games Store version is available now for $29.99—though its early release was “unintentionally pushed live” due to a technical issue during backend configuration, EC Digital Entertainment said in a note on Steam.

“We want to clarify that our intended long-term release platform includes Steam, and we’re now accelerating our efforts to finalize this version,” EC Digital Entertainment said. “As such, you may notice that the current Steam page includes placeholder content. This will be updated leading up to the official release.”

Scarface: The World Is Yours first launched for PlayStation 2, Xbox, and PC in 2006, followed by Wii in 2007.

The PC re-release will include an optional high-definition graphics mode, available as free downloadable content. According to EC Digital Entertainment, this mode uses artificial intelligence-assisted techniques to improve certain visual elements, “while keeping the core experience in tact.” The use of this mode is completely optional, and players can switch between original and enhanced visuals at any time.

Here is an overview of the game, via its store pages:

About

They thought you were dead. But Tony Montana doesn’t die so easily.

After the bloody betrayal at the hands of Sosa, Tony has lost everything—his mansion, his money, and his empire. But he’s not done. Not by a long shot.

Scarface: The World Is Yours returns in this re-release of the original classic third-person open-world action game. Featuring an optional high-definition graphics mode (downloadable content), this updated version lets a new generation of players experience Tony Montana’s explosive comeback in sharper detail than ever before.

Fight, deal, intimidate, and conquer your way across a fully open and seamless Miami—then expand to the islands beyond.

First you get the money, then you get the power, then you get revenge.

Key Features

  • Brutal Action with Tony’s Signature Flair – Take out enemies in bloody, cinematic combat using Tony’s unique style—guns blazing, insults flying.
  • Blind Rage Mode – When pushed too far, Tony enters a deadly rage, dealing extra damage and gaining health with each kill.
  • Empire-Building Gameplay – Grow your criminal enterprise by taking over territory, managing fronts, laundering money, and making deals.

item.title: MOUSE: P.I. for Hire delayed to early 2026
item.content:encoded:
PlaySide Publishing and developer Fumi Games have delayed noir cartoon-inspired first-person shooter MOUSE: P.I. for Hire from its previously planned 2025 release window to early 2026. It will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Here is the full message from the companies on the delay:

Hey everyone,

We know that you are all excited for the release date announcement of MOUSE: P.I. for Hire at the Galaxies Gaming Showcase this week on October 23.

Ahead of the reveal, we wanted to let you know that we have made the decision to move the launch of MOUSE: P.I. for Hire from 2025 to early 2026.

The support you have shown over the years has meant the world to us. Our single highest priority is for the game to deliver you the best possible experience, and this will help ensure we can live up to that goal.

Thanks for everything and we will see you at Galaxies!

—Fumi Games and PlaySide Studios

item.title: Sea Fantasy coming to PS5 on October 24
item.content:encoded:
• PS5

Currently available for Xbox Series, Xbox One, Switch, and PC.

METASLA will release pixel art open-world action RPG Sea Fantasy for PlayStation 5 via PlayStation Store on October 24, the developer announced.

Sea Fantasy first launched for PC via Steam on January 7, followed by Switch on June 19, and Xbox Series and Xbox One on July 18.

The PlayStation 5 version will launch alongside a collaboration with streamer Shinjisan, which will be available across all platforms.

Here is an overview of the game, via METASLA:

About

Save the world with fishing!?

This is the story of two young men who go on an adventure to catch the mysterious sea creatures called “Sea’Az.”

Key Features

  • “Sea’Az”: A Mysterious Marine Organism – In the world of Sea Fantasy, marine life called “Sea’Az” inhabit the oceans and lakes. They vary in appearance, size and rarity, and all Sea’Az can be fished.
  • Fishing the Sea’Az – To catch Sea’Az, perform a successful “Gauge Action”. Be careful, as there are Sea’Az with more powerful individual “gauge gimmick”.
  • Crafting with Sea’Az Materials – You can create equipment (fishing rods and hooks) using materials obtained from the Sea’Az you catch. By creating strong equipment, you can take advantage of the fishing action.
  • Explore by Boat – Players can obtain a ship by advancing through the storyline. Players can freely get on and off the ship and explore the vast pixel world.
  • Various 2D Actions Other Than Fishing – It is not only about fishing. You can enjoy various 2D action elements in between fishing.

item.title: Palworld Mobile playable at G-STAR 2025
item.content:encoded:
• Smartphone

Mobile adaption of open-world survival game set for formal debut.

Palworld Mobile, the mobile adaption of Pocketpair‘s Palworld, developed by PUBG Studios and published by KRAFTON, will be playable for the first time at G-STAR 2025, which will run from November 13 to 16 at Busan Exhibition and Convention Center in South Korea, KRAFTON announced.

Here is a preview of the publisher’s booth:

Palworld Mobile maintains the core features of the original Palworld, such as Pal catching and training, open-world survival, and construction, while implementing intuitive controls optimized for mobile, and “strategic battles that utilize various skills and offer a new gameplay experience.” A release date has yet to be announced.

item.title: Persona 3 Reload update announced, adds eight songs from Persona 3 vocalist Yumi Kawamura
item.content:encoded:
ATLUS will release a free update for Persona 3 Reload by October 23, featuring eight songs performed by Persona 3‘s original vocalist Yumi Kawamura, the company announced.

The update will allow players to experience Yumi Kawamura’s vocal tracks from Persona 3 and Persona 3 FES as background music during dungeon exploration and battles.

“It’s been a while!” Kawamura said in a message to fans. “I’m truly overjoyed and grateful to be reunited with everyone again. Persona 3 is a treasure to me as well—I can’t help but feel excited. Old friends, will you fight alongside me once more? New friends, how about letting my songs aid you in battle? Let’s celebrate together. Thank you for your continued support!”

The track list is as follows:

  • “Burn My Dread -Last Battle-“
  • “Mass Destruction”
  • “Deep Mentality”
  • “When The Moon’s Reaching Out Stars”
  • “Want to Be Close”
  • “Memories of You”
  • “Mass Destruction -P3fes Version-“
  • “Brand New Days”

Persona 3 Reload is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store, and will launch for Switch 2 on October 23.

item.title: Nintendo GameCube – Nintendo Classics adds Luigi’s Mansion on October 30
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Just in time for Halloween.

The Nintendo GameCube – Nintendo Classics for Switch 2 for Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion Pack subscribers will add Luigi’s Mansion on October 30, Nintendo announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Nintendo:

Luigi wins a stately mansion, but he’s in for a ghastly surprise when he creeps through its front door and learns that his magnificent manor is teeming with ghosts. And worse yet, Mario is nowhere to be found!

Enter Luigi’s Mansion, where a gallery of ghouls haunt the halls, secrets wait to be unearthed, and Luigi is … not the most courageous character around. Luckily, Professor E. Gadd is on the scene, and he has the perfect tools for the occasion! Play as Luigi, capture ghosts with the Poltergust 3000, track his items and whereabouts with the Game Boy™ Horror device, and help save Mario from a frightening fate in this action–adventure game originally released for the Nintendo GameCube system in 2001.

With Luigi’s Mansion joining Nintendo Classics, all three games in the series can now be played on Nintendo Switch 2, including Luigi’s Mansion 2 HD and Luigi’s Mansion 3. Take all three adventures for a spooky spin this Halloween!
